thread.section_title: McDonald’s worker leaps through drive-thru window to save customer’s life – Metro
thread.title: McDonald’s worker leaps through drive-thru window to save customer’s life
thread.title_full: McDonald’s worker leaps through drive-thru window to save customer’s life

author: Nicole Morley
title: McDonald’s worker leaps through drive-thru window to save customer’s life
text:
Pedro flung himself through the window to save a customer (Picture: CBS4 Miami) A McDonald’s worker leapt through the drive-thru window to save the life of a customer. 
Quick-thinking Pedro Viloria jumped through the hatch to rescue a customer who’d fallen unconscious behind the wheel with her kids in the back of the car.
Woman ‘repeatedly sexually assaulted’ on London bus on her way to work Pedro, 22, was serving breakfast to an off-duty police officer and her children at the McDonald’s store where he works in Florida.
‘I could see she was hardly breathing and I thought that’s not normal’, he told NBC Miami.
As the woman lost consciousness, her foot slipped off the brake and the car started to roll towards traffic.
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
He noticed the woman’s car started to roll away from the window (Picture: CBS4 Miami) ‘Her kids were screaming, “Mother, Mother stop it. Mother what are you doing”’, he added.
Without a second though Pedro quickly climbed through the window and ran after the car, which thankfully stopped before it rolled into traffic.
Queen grants Royal Assent for Theresa May to trigger Brexit Pedro said: ‘I thought, If these kids lose their mother today, that’s gonna be tragic.’
Luckily, a paramedic was also in the queue for the drive-thru and a Miami firefighter had called in for breakfast. They both performed CPR on the woman before emergency services arrived and revived her with a defibrillator.
The woman was taken to a nearby hospital.
Pedro was praised as a hero by his boss (Picture: CBS4 Miami) Pedro’s boss released a statement praising the McDonald’s employee’s actions: ‘First and foremost, our thoughts and prayers are with the officer and her family during this difficult time. I think I speak for our McDonald’s family when I say how proud we are of Pedro.
‘He is an excellent employee, so it didn’t surprise me that he took immediate action and jumped through a window to help save this woman. And he was not the only member of the team that played a pivotal role in ensuring she received the medical attention she needed.
‘A second employee, who asked to remain unnamed, assisted with CPR. Their quick thinking and action were everything in that moment.’
It’s not the first time this week a McDonald’s employee has been labelled a hero.
Yesterday a tweet from the verified McDonald Corps account told President Trump he was disgusting and had tiny hands .
The firm claim their account was compromised.
Twitter notified us that our account was compromised. We deleted the tweet, secured our account and are now investigating this.
— McDonald's (@McDonaldsCorp) March 16, 2017
